titleStmt.title: Site Index: Additions Template, for Adding and Updating Named Entities in the Digital Mitford Archive
titleStmt.author: Digital Mitford Editors

sponsor.orgName: Mary Russell Mitford Society: Digital Mitford Project

publicationStmt.authority: Digital Mitford: The Mary Russell Mitford Archive

availability.licence: Distributed under a Creative Commons Attribution-ShareAlike 3.0 Unported License

notesStmt.note: Any special notes on this text? (optional)

sourceDesc.p: Information on named entities in this file has been extracted from files in the Digital Mitford Archive.

occupation.affiliation: State University of New York, Potsdam

person.note: Courtney Younes Collins graduated in 2017 with a B.A. in English: Literature from the State University of New York at Potsdam. She worked as a Digital Mitford Research Assistant in Fall 2017. She plans to go on to graduate work and teaching in Elementary Education.

occupation.affiliation: State University of New York, Potsdam

person.note: Shawntel Courtney graduated in 2018 with a B.A. in English: Writing and a minor in Literature from the State University of New York at Potsdam. She worked as a Digital Mitford Research Assistant in Fall 2017 and Spring 2018. Her interests include scholarly editing and archives.

occupation.affiliation: State University of New York, Potsdam

person.note: Julie Fish graduated in 2017 with a B.A. in English: Literature from the State University of New York at Potsdam. She worked as a Digital Mitford Research Assistant in Spring and Fall 2017. Her interests include bibliographical studies and book history, and she hopes to pursue work in Library and Information Science.

occupation.affiliation: State University of New York, Potsdam

person.note: Allison McConlogue graduated in 2018 with a B.A. in Literature/Writing from the State University of New York at Potsdam and is a member of the English honor society Sigma Tau Delta. She worked as a Digital Mitford Research Assistant in Spring 2018. She plans to go on to graduate work and teaching in Middle/Secondary English Education.

occupation.affiliation: State University of New York, Potsdam

person.note: Lindsay Dingman plans to graduate in 2019 with a B.A. in Literature/Writing from the State University of New York at Potsdam. She began work as a Digital Mitford Research Assistant in Spring 2018. She plans to go on to graduate work and teaching in Middle/Secondary English Education.

occupation.affiliation: State University of New York, Potsdam

person.note: Anaya Phoenix plans to graduate in 2019 with a B.A. in Literature/Writing from the State University of New York at Potsdam. She began work as a Digital Mitford Research Assistant in Spring 2018. She plans to go on to graduate work and teaching in Middle/Secondary English Education.

occupation.affiliation: State University of New York, Potsdam

person.note: Sophia Morelli plans to graduate in 2019 with a B.A. in Literature/Writing from the State University of New York at Potsdam. She is a member of the English honor society, Sigma Tau Delta. She began work as a Digital Mitford Research Assistant in Summer 2018.

occupation.affiliation: Robert D. Clark Honors College, University of Oregon

person.note: Joshua Mostales is an undergraduate student in the Robert D. Clark Honors College at the University of Oregon. He excepts to receive his B.S. in Biochemistry in 2019. In summer 2017, he enrolled in Dr. Elizabeth Raisanen's Honors College colloquium on Digital Humanities and subsequently became involved with the Digital Mitford Project, working to transcribe one of Mitford's many letters to Sir William Elford.

occupation.affiliation: Robert D. Clark Honors College, University of Oregon

person.note: Lindsey Spillar expects to graduate from the Robert D. Clark Honors College at the University of Oregon in 2019 with a Bachelor of Science from the Lundquist College of Business with a focus in Finance. She is also completing a minor in Media Studies. In August 2017, she worked with Professor Elizabeth Raisanen in the Honors College for the Digital Mitford Project as a Research Assistant.

occupation.affiliation: Robert D. Clark Honors College, University of Oregon

person.note: Matt Nardoci is a biochemistry major at the University of Oregon and is expected to graduate in the summer of 2019. He started working with the Digital Mitford project while enrolled in a Robert D. Clark Honors College class in August of 2017 and has worked on a transcription of one of Mitford's letters.

occupation.affiliation: Robert D. Clark Honors College, University of Oregon

person.note: Madelyn N. Scott plans to graduate in 2020 with a B.S. in Chemistry from the Robert D. Clark Honors College at the University of Oregon. Her first encounter with the Digital Mitford Project was in Dr. Raisanen's Digital Humanities course in the summer of 2017. Madelyn was drawn to the technological component the project, which captures the interdisciplinary approach of the digital humanities field. For her final project in the course, Madelyn transcribed and coded Mitford's June 13, 1822 letter to Benjamin Robert Haydon.

occupation.affiliation: Robert D. Clark Honors College, University of Oregon>

person.note: Sophia Gemelas is an undergraduate student in the Robert D. Clark Honors College at the University of Oregon. She became involved with Digital Mitford in Summer 2017 when she enrolled in Dr. Elizabeth Raisanen's Digital Humanities class and coded a Mitford letter as part of her final project.
